HomePage.title: Hello world!
HomePage.subtitle: Mostly a backend developer — I still try my best to craft tidy frontends with Java, Kotlin, and a splash of React magic.
HomePage.heading: Latest project update

Footer.aboutStatement: Images used on About page — listed top to bottom (42 logo excluded)
Footer.educationStatement: Images used on Education page — listed top to bottom
Footer.attributionStatement: Below are the image attributions for assets used on this website. Additional attributions will be added as needed.

AboutMe.farming: I grew up working on farms and spent several years in agriculture before moving to Germany in 2019. Those years shaped a lot of my work ethic through the long hours, hands-on problem-solving, and staying calm when things don’t go as planned.
AboutMe.photography: After settling in Germany, alongside working on logisitics, I started freelancing in photography and videography. Running a small one-person business taught me responsibility, working with clients, and building something from scratch.
AboutMe.42: Over time, my interests shifted toward tech. I retrained as a software developer and joined 42 Heilbronn, where I learned C, C++, Python, algorithms, and system programming in a peer-driven learning environment.
AboutMe.schwarz: Most recently, I completed my internship at Schwarz IT, working with Kotlin, Vue.js(TypeScript), Docker, and microservice architectures. It confirmed that software development is exactly where I want to build my career.

Education.title: Education
Education.intro: My education doesn’t follow a straight line. It goes from British secondary school and a practical business qualification to a peer-driven coding school and a backend-focused internship in Germany. This timeline gives some context to how I learned and how I like to work today.
Education.ukSchoolBody: Standard British secondary education up to GCSE's, the UK’s equivalent to a Mittlerer Schulabschluss.
Education.ukSchoolPointOne: Core subjects such as English, Maths, Sciences...
Education.ukSchoolPointThree: Learnt to independently work for myself.
Education.ukSchoolImageAlt: School books and classroom items representing UK secondary education
Education.lewesBody: BTEC Level 3 in Business, a qualification in the UK that is equivalent to A-Levels or a Fachabitur.
Education.lewesPointOne: Coursework-based programme focused on real business.
Education.lewesPointThree: Planned small projects and justified decisions clearly.
Education.lewesImageAlt: College campus scene symbolising further education and business studies
Education.piscineBody: Selective, four-week intensive bootcamp used worldwide to identify self-driven developers This is used to recieve a place in a 42 school.
Education.piscinePointOne: Learned solely through documentation and peers.
Education.piscinePointTwo: Long days coding C, debugging, pressure.
Education.picinePointThree: Proved the ability to stay focused under stress.
Education.piscineImageAlt: Terminal windows and C code representing the Piscine programming bootcamp
Education.fortyTwoIntroBody: 42 is an internationally recognised programming school backed by leading companies.
Education.fortyTwoIntroPointOne: Learned by building software from scratch.
Education.fortyTwoIntroImageAlt: Stylised 42 logo and code editor representing the 42 school concept
Education.fortyTwoHeilbronnSite: Check out the official 42 Heilbronn website for more details
Education.fortyTwoJourneyTitle: My journey through the 42 core curriculum
Education.fortyTwoJourneyBody: Working through the 42 core curriculum taught me to build reliable software through deep problem understanding.
Education.fortyTwoJourneyPointOne: Built C-based projects involving memory, parsing and processes.
Education.fortyTwoJourneyImageAlt: Terminal windows and project boards showing intensive programming work
Education.internshipBody: I applied my 42 training in a real production environment during my internship at Schwarz IT.
Education.internshipPointOne: Kotlin, TypeScript, REST APIs, Docker, CI/CD.
Education.internshipPointTwo: Contributed to backend modules and Vue.js frontend work.
Education.internshipCtaLabel: Read more about my work experience
Education.internshipImageAlt: Developer workspace with multiple screens showing backend and frontend code
Education.certsBody: I am now continueing to expand my backend skills through structured Spring Boot courses.
Education.certsImageAlt: Laptop and notes representing online courses and programming certificates
